page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: Mr. Hookham's farm is next to our school. When they built the new school it was built in Mr. Hookham's field. Mr. Hookham's father used to cut down the thistles in the field where our new school was built. He was called Harry and he was ninety years old when he died. Old Mr. Hookham started our school when he was four years old. Many of the children who started school with him died before Christmas. They were only little. Mr. Hookham has got one great big barn where he dries the corn after it has been harvested. Then Halmshaw's lorries take it away because they are Corn Merchants.Mr. Hookham's fields go right down to the motorway. He grows sugar beet, wheat and barley. He has a few sheep, some guinea fowl and some peacocks but no cows. Mr. Hookham has a new tractor.
